meeting_day_one-start.text: Let the record show that Dr Pink, head of planetary defence, has now joined us
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: magenta

meeting_day_one-start.text: I call this meeting to order
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: magenta

meeting_day_one-start.text: Finally! Can I start? I'll start – I think this moon business is a load of crap!
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: green

meeting_day_one-start.text: I assure you it isn't, Dr Green; Calamitas will collide with our planet in less than three days from now
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: purple

meeting_day_one-start.text: I-in three days? It was just discovered, how is that p-possible...?
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: yellow

meeting_day_one-start.text: It's possible because the moon is travelling at a speed previously thought impossible, more than triple anything we've seen before
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: blue

meeting_day_one-start.text: While I agree that it is improbable, there's no use denying reality
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: blue

meeting_day_one-start.text: Indeed – it's happening and we must accept it
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: mint

meeting_day_one-start.text: Enough blathering on! I want to hear about what can be done
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: orange

meeting_day_one-start.text: Dr Pink, what is your solution? How shall we divert the moon's course?
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: orange

meeting_day_one-start.text: Yes, Dr Pink – I'd really like to hear it
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: cyan

meeting_day_one-start.text: Well I don't know about Pink, but from where I'm sitting there's only one feasible solution –
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: blue

meeting_day_one-start.text: May I finish? As I was saying, there's only one solution: X Y Z
meeting_day_one-start.speaker: blue

meeting_day_one-yes.text: (You have decided to sacrifice innocent lives to try to stop the moon)

meeting_day_one-no.text: (You have decided to not sacrifice innocent lives)
